org.wildfly.security.authz

Interface PermissionMapper


  • public interface PermissionMapper
    A permission mapper is responsible to enable permission mapping to a SecurityDomain in order to obtain and check permissions based on an previously authorized identity and any other authorization information (eg.: roles) associated with it.
    Author:
    Pedro Igor

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static PermissionMapper EMPTY_PERMISSION_MAPPER
      A default implementation that does nothing but returns an empty and read-only PermissionCollection.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PermissionCollection mapPermissions(Principal principal, Set<String> roles)
      Returns a read-only PermissionCollection with all the permissions associated with the given Principal and roles associated with it (if any).

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY_PERMISSION_MAPPER

        static final PermissionMapper EMPTY_PERMISSION_MAPPER
        A default implementation that does nothing but returns an empty and read-only PermissionCollection.

    • Method Detail

      • mapPermissions

        PermissionCollection mapPermissions(Principal principal,
                                    Set<String> roles)

        Returns a read-only PermissionCollection with all the permissions associated with the given Principal and roles associated with it (if any).

        Once returned, client code can use the PermissionCollection.implies(Permission) to check if a given permission is granted or not to the given principal. Implementors must make sure that the returned collection is immutable.

        Parameters:
        principal - a principal previously obtained and authenticated from a security domain (not null
        roles - a set of roles associated with the given principal after all role mapping was applied by security domain (may be null
        Returns:
        a read-only permission collection. If no permission is associated with the given identity, an empty and read-only PermissionCollection is returned (not null)
